newsitem.title: USA: Rational unveils software with Microsoft.
newsitem.headline: Rational unveils software with Microsoft.

text.p: Rational Software Corp on Wednesday said it has unveiled software based on its modeling language for use with Microsoft Corp's Visual Basic product.
Rational said its family of Rational Rose visual modeling tools is the result of development and marketing collaboration between Microsoft and Rational.
Rational's tools allow designers of large software systems to generate "quick and dirty" programming code to preview how a software blueprint might behave under real conditions.
Rational Rose for Visual Basic, the professional edition of the product, is available from Rational for $2,400.
Visual Modeler supports a subset of Rational's Unified Modeling Language, or UML, an industry standard for object-oriented software design.
UML defines a graphical language for describing the various components of a software system, Rational said.
